member.name: T:Sudoku.Solving.AnalysisResult
member.summary: Provides an analysis result after a puzzle solved.

member.name: M:Sudoku.Solving.AnalysisResult.#ctor(Sudoku.Data.Meta.Grid,System.String,System.Boolean,Sudoku.Data.Meta.Grid,System.TimeSpan,System.Collections.Generic.IReadOnlyList{Sudoku.Solving.TechniqueInfo},System.String)
member.summary: Initializes an instance with some information.
member.param: Indicates whether the puzzle has been solved.

summary.para: Indicates whether the puzzle has been solved.
If the puzzle has multiple solutions or no solution, this value will be always .
Indicates the maximum difficulty of the puzzle.

When the puzzle is solved by , the value will be the maximum value among all difficulty ratings in solving steps. If the puzzle has not been solved, or else the puzzle is solved by other solvers, this value will be always 20.0m.
Indicates the total difficulty rating of the puzzle.

When the puzzle is solved by , the value will be the sum of all difficulty ratings of steps. If the puzzle has not been solved, the value will be the sum of all difficulty ratings of steps recorded in . However, if the puzzle is solved by other solvers, this value will be 0.
Indicates the pearl difficulty rating of the puzzle, calculated during only by .
When the puzzle is solved, the value will be the difficulty rating of the first solving step. If the puzzle has not solved or the puzzle is solved by other solvers, this value will be always 0.
Indicates the pearl difficulty rating of the puzzle, calculated during only by .

When the puzzle is solved, the value will be the difficulty rating of the first step before the first one whose conclusion is . If the puzzle has not solved or solved by other solvers, this value will be 20.0m.

member.name: M:Sudoku.Solving.Manual.ManualSolver.CheckEliminations(Sudoku.Data.Meta.Grid,System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{Sudoku.Solving.Conclusion})
member.summary: To check the validity of all conclusions.

summary.para: Indicates the solver will optimizes the applying order.
When the value is , the result to apply to the grid will be the one which has the minimum difficulty rating; otherwise, the applying step will be the first one of all steps being searched.
The value is in default case.
Indicates whether the solver should check all technique information using the strict technique searchers order.

If the value is , all technique searchers will be enabled calculation in order. It ensures the strictness of difficulty rating that the maximum difficulty searched in one searcher should be no more than the minimum one searched in the searcher behind the previous one.

The value is in default case. In addition, if this value is , the option will be disabled. In other words, this option does not work while solving when the condition is satisfied. However, the time of calculation with this value will be much slower than that with the value is .

member.name: P:Sudoku.Solving.Manual.ManualSolver.EnableFullHouse

summary.para: Indicates whether the solver will record the step whose name or kind is full house.
The value is in default case.

member.remarks: Full houses are the techniques that used in a single region. When the specified region has only one empty cell, the full house will be found at this empty cell (the last value in this region).

member.name: P:Sudoku.Solving.Manual.ManualSolver.EnableLastDigit

summary.para: Indicates whether the solver will record the step whose name or kind is last digit.
The value is in default case.

member.remarks: Last digits are the techniques that used in a single digit. When the whole grid has 8 same digits, the last one will be always found and set in the last position, which is last digit.

summary.para: Indicates whether the solver should add brute force technique information when the puzzle has a unique solution but cannot be found any manual techniques.
The value is in default case.

member.name: P:Sudoku.Solving.Manual.ManualSolver.CheckIncompletedUniquenessPatterns

summary.para: Indicates whether the solver should check incompleted uniqueness patterns.
The value is in default case.

member.example:
For example, An basic UR pattern should be
ab ab ab abc
But sometimes, some digits will be missed in the pattern like this:
ab ab ab ac
The candidate a is also can be eliminated.

member.name: P:Sudoku.Solving.Manual.ManualSolver.CheckRegularWingSize

summary.para: Indicates all regular wings with the size less than or equals to this specified value. This value should be between 3 and 5.
The value is 5 in default case.

member.remarks: In fact this value can be 9 at most (i.e. value >= 3 && value <= 9) theoretically, however the searching is too low so I do not allow them.

member.name: P:Sudoku.Solving.Manual.Uniqueness.Rectangles.UniqueRectangleDetailData.Type

summary.para: Indicates the type of the unique rectangle, where the value is between 1 to 9.
You can find all types in detail in 'remarks' part of this page.

member.remarks:
All types:
Type 1 Basic type.
Type 2 Generalized locked candidates type.
Type 3
Generalized subset type (+ naked or hidden subset).
Type 4 Conjugate pair type.
Type 5
Type-2 extended type (with three additional same digit).
Type 6
Type-4 extended type (with two parallel conjugate pairs, and they hold a same digit).
Type 7 Type alias hidden rectangle.
Type 8 Basic type.
Type 9 Basic type.

member.name: M:Sudoku.Solving.Utils.GridUtils.GetDigitAppearingMask(Sudoku.Data.Meta.Grid,System.Int32,System.Int32)

summary.para: Gets a mask of digit appearing in the specified region offset.
Note that given and modifiable values always make this method return .

member.returns: The mask. This value consists of 9 bits, which represents all nine cells in a specified region. The mask uses 1 to make the cell 'have this digit', and 0 to make the cell 'does not have this digit'.
